publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

msContents.summary: I) Dāwit “Psalter” (fols. 5r-177v, 178r-179v) I-1) Mazmura Dāwit “Psalms of David” (fols. 5r-138v, 178r-179v) I-2) Maḥālǝya nabiyāt “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 139r-154r) I-3) Maḥālǝya maḥālǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 154r-162v) I-4) Wǝddāse Māryām “Praise of Mary” (fols. 163ra-173rb) I-5) ʾAnqaṣa bǝrhān “The Gate of Light” (fols. 173rb-177va) Additiones 1-3.

msItem.title: Dāwit "Psalter"

listBibl.bibl: JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), 4r-163vb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

msItem.note: The Ethiopic Psalter usually includes: I) Mazmura Dāwit "Psalms of David" II) Maḥālǝya nabiyāt "The Canticles of the Prophets" III) Maḥālǝya maḥālǝy "Song of Songs" IV) Wǝddāse Māryām “Glory of Mary” V) Anqäṣä bǝrhān “The Gate of Light”.

msItem.title: I) Mazmura Dāwit "Psalms of David"
msItem.incipit: 5r: ፍካሬ፡ ዘጻድቃን፡ ወኃጥአን፨ መዝሙር፡ ዘዳዊት፨ ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፨ ፩። ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘኢሖረ፡ በምክረ፡ ረሲዓን፨Ps. 1:1.
msItem.explicit: 138v, l.13: ወአንሰ፡ ነሣእኩ፡ ዘእምላዕሌሁ፡ ሰይፈ፨ ወመተርኩ፡ ርእሶ፨ ወአሰሰልኩ፡ ጽእለተ፡ እምደቂቁ፡ እስራኤል፨P151

listBibl.bibl: JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), 4r-126r (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

msItem.title: II) Maḥālǝya nabiyāt “The Canticles of the Prophets”
msItem.incipit: 139r: መኀልየ፡ ዘነቢያት፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ለሙሴ። ፩። ንሴብሖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ስቡሐ፡ ዘተሰብሐ፨ ፈረሰ፡ ወመስተጽዕነ፡ ወረወ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር፨
msItem.explicit: 154r, l.4: …ከመ፡ ትክሥት፡ ብርሃነ፡ ለአሕዛብ፨ ወክብረ፡ ለሕዝብከ፡ እስራኤል፨

listBibl.bibl: JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), 126r-138v (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

note.p: First Song of Moses (Ex. 15:1–19): fols. 133r-140r; Second Song of Moses (Deut. 32:1–21): fols. 140r-141v; Third Song of Moses (Deut. 32:22–43): fols. 141v-143v; Song of Hannah (I Sam. 2:1–10): fols. 143v-144v; Prayer of Hezekiah (I38:10–20): fols. 144v-145v; Prayer of Manasseh (apocryphal): fols. 145v-146v; Song of Jonah (Jon. 2:3–10): fols. 146v-147r; First Song of the Three Youths in the Furnace (Dan. 3:26–45): fols. 147r-148r; Second Song of the Three Youths (Dan. 3:52–56): fols. 148r-148v; Third Song of the Three Youths (Dan. 3:57–88): fols. 148v-150r; Song of Habakkuk (Hab. 3:1–19): fols. 150r-151v; Song of Isaiah (I26:9–20): fols. 152r-152v; Song of Our Lady Mary (Lk. 1:46–55): fols. 152v-153r; Song of Zachariah (Lk. 1:68–79): fols. 153r-153v; Song of Simeon (Lk. 2:29–32): fols. 153v-154r.

msItem.title: III) Maḥālǝya maḥālǝy “Song of Songs”
msItem.incipit: 154r, l.6: መኀልየ፡ መኀልይ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ ዘሰሎሞን። ፩። ይስዕመኒ፡ በስዕመተ፡ አፉሁ፨ አዳም፡ አጥባትኪ፡ እምወይን፨
msItem.explicit: 162v, l.11: ጕይ፡ አንተ፡ ወልድ፡ እኁየ፡ ወተመሰላ፡ ለወይጠል፨ ወእመአኮ፡ ከመ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ሀየል፨ ውስተ፡ አድባር፡ ድሑሐን፨

listBibl.bibl: JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), 139r-146r (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

note.p: Each strophe of the text is preceeded by a doxology written in red: ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ።

msItem.title: IV) Wǝddāse Māryām “Praise of Mary”
msItem.incipit: 163ra, l.1:ውዳሴ፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ዘሰኑይ፨ ፈቀደ፡ እግዚእ፡ ያግዕዞ፡ ለአዳም፡ ሕዙነ፡ ወትኩዘ፡ ልብ፡ ወያግብኦ፡ ኀበ፡ ዘትካት፡ መንበሩ። ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት።
msItem.explicit: 173rb, l.11: ይጸግወነ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ወምሕረቶ፡ ይስረይ፡ ኀጢአተነ፡ በብዝኀ፡ ምሕረቱ፨ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፨

listBibl.bibl: JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), 146ra-158rb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

note.p: The text divided into the portions according to the days of the week; incipits of the portions are rubricated.

msItem.title: V) Anqäṣä bǝrhān “The Gate of Light”
msItem.incipit: 173rb, l.14:ውዳሴ፡ ወግናይ፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ቅድስት፡ ወብፅዕት፡ ስብሕት፡ ወቡርክት፡ ክብርት፡ ወልዕልት፡ ዓንቀጸ፡ ብርሃን፡ መዓርገ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወማኅደረ፡ መለኮት፨
msItem.explicit: 177rb, l.15: ስብሐት፡ ለኪ፡ ኦወላዲተ፡ እግዚአ፡ ኲሉ፡ አኰቴት፡ ወክብር፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፨ ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ [177va]ይክፍለነ፨ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፨

listBibl.bibl: JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), 158rb-163vb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

msItem.title: VI) Unidentified text
msItem.incipit: 177va, l.2: ዘ፫ሰዓት። እኤምኅ፡ አዕጋሪከ፡ በጊዜ፡ ፫፡ ሰዓት፡ ቅድመ፡ ጲላጦስ፡ ዘቆማ፤ ኢየሱስ፡ ጠቢብ፡ ወንጉሥ፡ ፌማ፤ ዘአድከምከ፡ ኃይለ፡ መስቴማ። ስ። እንዘ፡ ይሰልቡ፡ ልብሰከ፡ ወክዳነከ፡ ፀዓዳ፤ እንተ፡ አልበሱከ፡ ከለሜዳ፤ ኢየሱስ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ይሁዳ። 177va: For the third hour. I salute your feet at the time of the third hour, that stood in front of Pilate, Jesus the Wise and the King Fema who made powerless the force of Satan. G[lory to you!] While they were stripping off your clothes and your white tunic, since they put a scarlet robe upon you, Jesus, the King of Judah...

msItem.note: - Traditional titles of the Pss. are missing.
- Traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in P118 is missing.
- A few mistakes in the numbering of the Pss.

supportDesc.extent: Made of 179.0 folios, of which blank 1r, in 23.0 quires (A+22). 185 165 50

list.item:
8
XXII(8/fols. 170r-177v). ff. 178 and 179, have been extracted from their proper places (fol. 178 should follow fol. 131v; fol. 179 should follow fol. 125v) and attached to the back of quire XXII.

supportDesc.condition: The front board is broken and repaired with a cord and with leather strips; the back board is missing. At least one fol. is missing, between 59 and 60 (containing a part of P66 ans P67). 178 and 179 are misplaced: 178 should follow 131v; 179 should follow 125v. 53 is placed in the reversed position. Many fols. are stained with wax and some are stained with water. The edges of many fols. are uneven.

layout.note: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for 13r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for 165r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: II. Nine dot asterisk; four dot asterisks (in red, for the titles of the Psalms)
III. Chain of black and red dots (5r; 12r; 20v; 29r; 40r; 49r; 55v; 64v; 77v; 87r; 94r; 113v; 122v; 178v; 179r);
two chains of black and red dots (93v; 138v);
two chains of black and red dots with three nine dot asterisks between them (162v);
two or three nine dot asterisks (at the end of each daily portion of Wǝddāse Māryām);
three nine dot asterisks with a chain of black and red dots beneath them (154r).
In the left margin the sign ፼ is consistently written throughout the Psalter and the Canticles of the Prophets, in front of each tenth to fourteenth line.
ሰአ፡ ቅድስት፡/ሰአ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት
Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain.
ሠረቀ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (163ra-vb)
እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (164rb-165vb)
ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (166rb-167vb)
ነዓብየኪ፡ for ነዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (168va-169vb)
ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (170rb-vb)
ተፈሥሒ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (171va-172ra)
ወበ: እንተዝ፡ for ወበ: እንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (172va-173ra)
ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ፤ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት
Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain.
ወበ:/ወበ: እንተዝ፡ for ወበ: እንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (174rb-177ra

handDesc.handNote: Numeral ፮ “six” looks like compressed numeral ፯ “seven” (e.g., 25r, 34r, 59v, 103r).

list.item:
ff. 1va-3 rb: Hymn to St Mary Bǝḍǝʿǝt ʾanti… “Blessed you are…”, incomplete.
1va, l.4: ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ ብፅዕት፡ አንቲ፡ ወንግሥተ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ዘትሜንኒ፡ ማርያም፡ መንበረ፡ ሥላት። ... [3rb, l.19] ማርያም፡ አስምዒ፡ ለኃይለኪ[sic]፡ ድምጾ፡ ለፀረ፡ አርዌ፡ ዘየዓቅፆ፨ እስመ፡ አብዝኃ፡ ትዕግልተ፡ ወአመፆ ፨፨፨
1va: Halleluja, halleluja, halleluja! Blessed are you and the Queen of Righteousness, you who despise, Mary, the seat of mockery… [3rb] Mary, make your powerful voice heard, which ensnares the enemy, the Serpent, for he has multiplied violence and iniquity. The note is written in a crude hand. Cp. ChRep n292 ; GrohHymn 30; Maṣḥafa säʿatat mǝslä kʷǝllu ṣäwatǝwihu wa-baḥrä ḥassab, Aśmära 1975 E.C., 208-223 (“Sǝbḥāta fequr”). O. RAINERI, “L’inno mariano etiopico «Beṣeʕet anti» (Beata sei) del «Sebḥata Fequr» (Celebrazione del diletto)”, OrChrP 52, 1986, 421-431.

ff. 3va-4 rb: Sǝbḥāta fǝqur za-Giyorgis “Praise of the Beloved St George”.
3va, l.14: [ናቄርብ፡ ለከ፡ ስብሐተ፡ ወጋዳ፡ ለጊዮርጊስ]፡ ኮከበ፡ ልዳ፨ ለስእለትየ፡ ኢታውኅዳ፤ ጸሐፉ፡ ወትረ፡ በሰለዳ፡ ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፨ ነዓ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ እንዘ፡ ትሰርር፡ በፈረስ፤… [4vb, l.14] በእንተ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ቅድስት፡ ለኤዎስጣቴዎስ፡ አቡነ፤ ክርስቶስ፡ አምላክነ፤ ወመድኃኒነ፤ ምህልነ፡ ስማዕ፡ ፍጡነ፨
3va: We are offering to you the praise and tribute, for the star of Lydda... For the sake of the holy prayer of Ewosṭatewos, our father, Christ, our God and our Savior, quickly listen to our supplication. The prayer is written in the same crude hand as Additio 1. Cp. Ms. St Petersburg, Koriander 1, 37 (TurPet 76, n31 ). The hymn under the same title included in the edition Maṣḥafa säʿatat mǝslä kʷǝllu ṣäwatǝwihu wa-baḥrä ḥassab, Aśmära 1975 E.C., 223-229, shares with the given text only a few lines, the rest is dissimilar.

- The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a line of alternating black and red dots. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line or the end of the line: 29r, 61r, 73v, 75r, 79v, 88v, 91r, 96r, 115r, 123r. - Ethiopic numerals ፻፻ are written beside a verse of a Ps. or a Canticle on 6r-153r. - Omitted letters and words written interlineally, in a secondary hand: 9r, 133v, 136r, 160v, 161r, 162r. - Corrections written over erasures, in the main hand and in a secondary hand: 7r, 66v, 69v, 72r, 99r, 100r, 101r, 115r, 127v, 128r, 131r, 145r, 146v, 153r, 153v, 165rb, 165vb, 171rb, 171vab, 175vb, 177ra. - Erasures marked with thin lines: 127v, 152r, 163v, 165rb, 165va, 167rb, 172ra, 173vab, 174vb. - Scribbles: 1r, 3r.

item.desc: Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the upper margin, in a secondary crude hand, the same which added supplication formulas: ስኑይ፡ fol. 5r ዘስሉስ፡ fol. 29r ዘረቡዕ፡ fol. 55v ዘሐሙስ፡ fol. 77v ዘዓርብ፡ fol. 108v ዘዕሁድ፡ fol. 139r ዘቀደም፡ fol. 179r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired; the back board is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Names of Fāsiladas (12r, 29r, 93v, 108v, 138v), Gabra Ḥǝywat (55v, 93v, 138v), ʾabuna Walda Śǝllāse (93v, 138v, 179r), Walda Gärima (138v) are written in the supplication formulas added by a secondary crude hand, the same which wrote the names of the days of the week.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
